title: 'I was a stage manager and now I'm a bike mechanic'
description: Laura Wilson from west London takes us through her week during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: England braced for physical battle with 'in your face' Ireland
description: England are expecting a tough battle against an "in your face" Ireland team in Saturday's Autumn Nations Cup match, says Billy Vunipola.

title: Jan Morris, a poet of time, place and self
description: She was an award-winning journalist and author with more than 40 books under her belt.

title: Covid: What is a circuit-breaker could one fight the virus?
description: Can a short burst of national restrictions change the course of the epidemic?

title: Priti Patel: Bullying inquiry head quits as PM backs home secretary
description: Boris Johnson's standards adviser resigns after the PM rejects findings of Priti Patel bullying inquiry.

title: Covid-19: Flu jab push as Covid vaccine roll-out planned
description: Matt Hancock said the NHS was preparing to roll out a Covid-19 vaccine if one is approved for use.

title: Sunak mulls public sector pay freeze for millions
description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak is trying to bolster public finances after huge spending to fight coronavirus.

title: Jones questions Ireland prop Porter's scrum technique
description: Ireland prop Andrew Porter's scrummaging technique "may need some referee intervention" in Saturday's match, says England coach Eddie Jones.

title: Hip-hop star Rodney P admits ex-girlfriend attack
description: The ex-BBC 1Xtra DJ confirms he was given a prison sentence in 2012 for assaulting another woman

title: UFC 257: Conor McGregor v Dustin Poirier 2 confirmed for January
description: Former two-weight UFC champion Conor McGregor will return to the octagon in January for a second fight with Dustin Poirier.

title: Covid: Christmas restrictions warning if Wales' cases rise
description: Wales' First Minister Mark Drakeford tells people not to "fritter away" the "success" of lockdown.

title: UK borrowing hits highest October level on record
description: The government borrowed £22.3bn in October - its highest for the month since records began.

title: Pope Francis: Vatican investigates Brazilian model Instagram photo like
description: "As far as we know, the 'like' did not come from the Holy See, a Vatican spokesperson said.

title: Killer drug GHB 'should be reclassified', says official report
description: GHB has been used in a series of murders but is currently in the same category as anabolic steroids.

title: Booker Prize 2020: Douglas Stuart's novel Shuggie Bain wins
description: The Scottish writer's book about a boy and his mother's struggles in 1980s Glasgow wins the prize.

title: Christian B: Madeleine McCann suspect's rape appeal rejected
description: The decision means he will remain in prison beyond January when a sentence for dug offences ends.

title: Coronavirus: Angry reaction to NI's new lockdown measures
description: The agreement reached by Stormont on imposing tougher restrictions prompts angry reaction.

title: US election 2020: Biden wins Georgia recount as Trump setbacks mount
description: As a Georgia audit confirms his victory, the president-elect blasts Donald Trump's "irresponsibility".

title: Trans Day of Remembrance: 'When one of us is hurt, we all feel it'
description: Numbers released ahead of this year's Trans Day of Remembrance show a rise in transgender murders.

title: Youssoufa Moukoko: Meet Borussia Dortmund's 16-year-old 'wunderkind'
description: Borussia Dortmund's 16-year-old 'wunderkind' Youssoufa Moukoko could become the Bundesliga and Champions League's youngest player in the coming days.

title: Hamilton on meditation, chasing perfection and showing his human side
description: This may have been the year Lewis Hamilton became a true great, but it's issues in the wider world that drive him ever further.

title: The Papers: Covid 'jab joy' and public sector pay 'blow'
description: Friday's papers report on preparations to begin the first Covid vaccinations in the next two weeks.

title: Trumplomacy: Mike Pompeo eyes history on Israel swansong trip
description: The visit is as much about putting pressure on Iran as it is about shoring up the Israeli right.

title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: Fact-checking misleading images
description: Manipulated and false images with no relation to the crisis in Ethiopia are being shared online.

title: Coronavirus: Scrabble, baking and how we beat loneliness together
description: Karolina, 36, and Joan, 88, live together as part of an initiative to tackle loneliness.

title: Melania Trump's hometown in Slovenia hopes its fame will last
description: For four years this Slovenian town has enjoyed its link to the First Lady but an era is about to end.

title: Can we rescue the office Christmas party this year?
description: Some companies are finding ingenious ways of getting into the Christmas spirit against the odds.

title: Wands revive memories of the smart home dream
description: Lights, heating and fridges were all supposed to be internet connected, but it never really happened. Why?

title: Bollywood-backed Indian ballet prodigy finds feet in London
description: Kamal Singh is training at the English National Ballet School after raising the fees online.

title: Inside test-and-trace - how the 'world beater' went wrong
description: BBC News spoke to key government figures, scientists and health officials involved from the start.

title: The Caribbean islands poisoned by a pesticide
description: On Martinique and Guadeloupe a pesticide has poisoned the soil and water and caused many cases of prostate cancer.

title: Remembering Nuremberg 75 years on
description: Fergal Keane looks at their legacy and speaks to a Holocaust survivor, a prosecutor and the son of a defendant.

title: US election: How other incumbents left the White House after losing
description: Donald Trump joins a small group of US presidents who lost the election while in office.

title: Covid: Lockdown ‘sci-fisolation’ movie goes viral
description: The spoof created by actors Brendan O’Rourke and Kevin Mains stars some of Hollywood’s big names.

title: Swine flu: Woman, 26, still 'suffering' a decade after catching virus
description: Saffra Monteiro caught it as a girl and wants young people to take viruses, like Covid-19, seriously.
